content.p: The support staff and practioners that deliver athlete support services have worked with Olympic, Commonwealth and World Championships athletes around the world. Explore our performance support programme below and find our why University of Nottingham is one of the top student-athlete performance environments in the U.K. Athletes work with our dedicated strength and conditioning team, who focuses on injury prevention and performance management. Our on-site sports injury clinic boasts a hydrotherapy pool and ice-cold plunge pool to add water-based recovery to our sports massage and rehabilitation services. Our nutritionist plays a supportive and collaborative role in ensuring athletes’ needs are met – both on and off the field. We cover everything from meal planning to nutrition education during sessions. With student-athlete wellbeing our primary aim, our teams work with a sport psychologist to assist athletes and coaches to achieve optimal psychological preparedness for training and competitions. Our aim is to support athlete well-being and to encourage and facilitate their personal and professional development alongside their competitive sporting careers Our coaching team includes some of of the country's top experts, with many programmes hosting full-time staff dedicated to performance sport. David Ross Sports Village University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD telephone: +44 (0)115 74 87000 email: sport@nottingham.ac.uk
